An old server encrypts secrets using RSA, but its keys are generated from Blum integers. Can you decrypt the hidden flag? Ciphertext: 2940018196527098835817825536413583411307235302161580781105038286517403473744297901580530837303866182056610880903434199156434455669020838102946781840478989

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6925443797462573660679131451647813692840924573212162423466740153008857278087209983097495267783861573344337192447824091404593179497293710845449170112493061, e=2616877814618048080869652221572540867648614533711535462409283036640661842477102574676606365574201884933989808296486799130604133902142753315657855975590457
The lower 104 bits of p are: 83653855180607141480775789054133575075


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{hb43ur2z}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2940018196527098835817825536413583411307235302161580781105038286517403473744297901580530837303866182056610880903434199156434455669020838102946781840478989
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6925443797462573660679131451647813692840924573212162423466740153008857278087209983097495267783861573344337192447824091404593179497293710845449170112493061, e=2616877814618048080869652221572540867648614533711535462409283036640661842477102574676606365574201884933989808296486799130604133902142753315657855975590457
The lower 104 bits of p are: 83653855180607141480775789054133575075

extra_info: p=68007167210268753514099835796396683359678236483439310188781939468403986439587, q=101834028405418791265813005969012431082012697246266125588428243277230564558903, Ï†(n)=6925443797462573660679131451647813692840924573212162423466740153008857278087040141901879580239081660502571783333382400470863474061516500662703535561494572
